wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant-General Sir Edward Peter Strickland  (3 August 1869 – 24 June 1951) was a British Army officer who commanded 1st Infantry Division during the First World War.

response: Harrod married Wilhelmine "Billa" Cresswell (1911–2005), step-daughter of General Sir Peter Strickland, in 1938.Josceline Dimbleby Billa Harrod, The Guardian, 10 June 2005 One of their sons was Dominick Harrod, an economics correspondent for the BBC.Obituary: Dominick Harrod, telegraph.co.uk, 5 August 2013
*1917–1946: Gen. Sir Edward Peter Strickland, KCB, KBE, CMG, DSO

Conservative Party leader Bonar Law said "in the present condition of Ireland, we are much more likely to get an impartial inquiry in a military court than in any other". Greenwood announced that a military inquiry would be carried out by General Peter Strickland. This resulted in the "Strickland Report","Greenwood heckled on Strickland Report", The New York Times, 17 February 1921. but Cork Corporation instructed its employees and other corporate officials to take no part. The report blamed members of the Auxiliaries' K Company, based at Victoria Barracks. The Auxiliaries, it was claimed, burnt the city centre in reprisal for the IRA attack at Dillon's Cross. The British Government refused to publish the report.

The flank attack on the north end also reached its objective, met the main attacking force at  and sniped at the Germans as they retreated towards the second position; only  of the I Battalion, GR 9 making it back. The village was consolidated with the help of an engineer field company inside a box barrage, maintained all night and a large counter-attack was repulsed by bombers at  Two more field companies were delayed by German artillery-fire and then by congestion and took until morning to arrive. The troops of the 23rd Division began to be relieved by the 1st Division (Major-General Peter Strickland).

Her father was killed in action at Mons not long after the beginning of the First World War, aged 31. Her mother remarried in 1918, General Sir Peter Strickland (1869–1951). She had a sister, Puffin, and they grew up in Egypt, where their stepfather was the Commander-in-Chief of British forces.
